definitions: To elect into a body by the votes of its existing members.
To assimilate, take over, or win over an opposing group or individual into one's own group or cause, especially so as to deprive them of their distinctiveness or power.
To adopt an idea or policy from another group or party and make it one's own.
examples: The committee decided to co-opt a new member.
The movement was co-opted by the mainstream.
They tried to co-opt the rival's best ideas.
